greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n containing a clique of size 2.
comment: All parts of a number partition with the same value form a clique. The size of a clique is the number of elements in the clique.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
example: a(7) = 5, because 5 partitions of 7 contain (at least) one clique of size 2: [1,1,1,2,2], [1,1,2,3], [2,2,3], [1,3,3], [1,1,5].
mathematica: max = 50; f = (1 - Product[1 - x^(2j) + x^(3j), {j, 1, max}])/Product[1 - x^j, {j, 1, max}]; s = Series[f, {x, 0, max}]; Drop[CoefficientList[s, x], 2] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 01 2014 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 05 2011
